alert.note: Alert for Cleveland; Lincoln; Oklahoma (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 24 at 9:34AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of north central Garvin, southeastern Oklahoma, southwestern Lincoln, Cleveland, western Pottawatomie and south central McClain Counties through 1015 AM CDT... At 934 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Oklahoma City to near Norman to near Slaughterville to near Wayne. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Southeastern Oklahoma City, Norman, Moore, Midwest City, Purcell, Choctaw, Noble, Harrah, Slaughterville, McLoud, Nicoma Park, Lexington, Pink, Maysville, Wellston, Wayne, Tribbey, Wanette, Warwick and Etowah. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 80 and 101. Interstate 40 between mile markers 158 and 182. Interstate 44 between mile markers 157 and 160. Interstate 240 between mile markers 9 and 16. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
